sen.j: 鴨川（かもがわ）は、京都府京都市を流れる淀川水系の一級河川。
sen.e: The Kamogawa River is a class A river in the Yodo-gawa River System that flows through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Kamogawa River is a class A river in the Yodo-gawa River System that flows through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Kamogawa River is a first class river in the Yodo-gawa River System that flows through Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 河川法における鴨川の起点は、京都市北区 (京都市)雲ヶ畑の出合橋付近である。
sen.e: The starting point of the Kamogawa River in the River Act is around the Deai-bashi Bridge in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
The starting point of the Kamogawa River in the River Act is around the Deai-bashi Bridge in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
The starting point of the Kamogawa River in the River Act is around the Deai-bashi Bridge in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北区雲ヶ畑の桟敷ヶ岳東部の谷を源とする祖父谷川と、桟敷ヶ岳南部の薬師峠を源とする雲ヶ畑岩屋川が雲ヶ畑岩屋橋で合流し雲ヶ畑川となる。
sen.e: Meeting at the Kumogahata Iwaya-bashi Bridge, the Sofudani-gawa River, which originates in the east of Mt. Sajikiga-take in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, and the Kumogahata-Iwaya-gawa River, which originates in Yakushi-toge Mountain Pass in the south of Mt. Sajikiga-take, change their name to the Kumogahata-gawa River.

Meeting at the Kumogahata Iwaya-bashi Bridge, the Sofudani-gawa River, which originates in the east of Mt. Sajikiga-take in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, and the Kumogahata-Iwaya-gawa River, which originates in Yakushi-toge Mountain Pass in the south of Mt. Sajikiga-take, change their name to the Kumogahata-gawa River.

Meeting at the Kumogahata Iwaya-bashi Bridge, the Sofudani-gawa River, which originates in the east of Mt. Sajikiga-take in Kumogahata, Kita Ward, and the Kumogahata-Iwaya-gawa River, which originates in Yakushi-toge Mountain Pass in the south of Mt. Sajikiga-take, change their name to the Kumogahata-gawa River.

sen.j: 雲ヶ畑川は、雲ヶ畑の魚谷山南部の谷を源とする中津川と出合橋で合流し、これより「鴨川」となる。
sen.e: The Kumogahata-gawa River, joined at the Deai-bashi Bridge by the Nakatsu-gawa River originating in the valley of Mt. Iodani-yama in Kumogahata, becomes the Kamogawa River from there on.
The Kumogahata-gawa River, joined at the Deai-bashi Bridge by the Nakatsu-gawa River originating in the valley of Mt. Iodani-yama in Kumogahata, becomes the Kamogawa River from there on.
The Kumogahata-gawa River, joined at the Deai-bashi Bridge by the Nakatsu-gawa River originating in the valley of Mt. Iodani-yama in Kumogahata, becomes the Kamogawa River from there on.

sen.j: 鴨川起点の表記は中津川下流域にあるため、これに従うと源流は中津川であると考えられるが、これはあくまでも河川法上での扱いであり、伝統的には桟敷ヶ岳を源流と見なす人も多い。
sen.e: Because the sign indicating the starting point of the river is placed at the lower Nakatsu-gawa River, the source of the Kamogawa River may be believed to be the Nakatsu-gawa River; however, this is the case in the River Act, and traditionally, there are a great deal of people who regard Mt. Sajikiga-take as the source.

Since the sign indicating the starting point of the river is located at the lower Nakatsu-gawa River, the source of the Kamogawa River may be believed to be the Nakatsu-gawa River; however, this is the case in the River Act, and traditionally, there are a great deal of people who regard Mt. Sajikiga-take as the source.

Since the sign indicating the starting point of the river is located at the lower Nakatsu-gawa River, the source of the Kamogawa River may be believed to be the Nakatsu-gawa River; however, this is the case in the River Act, and traditionally, there are a great deal of people who regard Mt. Sajikiga-take as the source.

sen.j: また、この鴨川本流とは別に、京都市右京区の芹生峠を源とする貴船川と、京都市左京区の花脊峠を源とする鞍馬川が貴船口で合流する鞍馬川がある。
sen.e: In addition to the main river, the Kamogawa River has a tributary, called 'Kurama-gawa River,' which originates in Hanse-toge Mountain Pass in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and is joined at Kibune-guchi by the Kurama-gawa River, originating in Seryo-toge Mountain Pass in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

In addition to the main river, the Kamogawa River has a tributary, called 'Kurama-gawa River,' which originates in Hanse-toge Mountain Pass in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and is joined at Kibune-guchi by the Kurama-gawa River, originating in Seryo-toge Mountain Pass in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

In addition to the main river, the Kamogawa River has a tributary, called Kurama-gawa River, which originates in Hanse-toge Mountain Pass in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and is joined at Kibune-guchi by the Kibune-gawa River, originating in Seryo-toge Mountain Pass in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: Kurama-gawa River→Kibune-gawa River原文に「」のない' 'を削除

sen.j: 鞍馬川は山幸橋で鴨川と合流し大きな流れとなる。
sen.e: The Kamogawa and the Kurama-gawa Rivers meet at the Sanko-bashi Bridge to form a larger river.
The Kamogawa and the Kurama-gawa Rivers meet at the Sanko-bashi Bridge to form a larger river.
The Kamogawa and the Kurama-gawa Rivers meet at the Sanko-bashi Bridge to form a larger river.

sen.j: 貴船神社社伝においては、神武天皇の母である玉依姫命が、淀川、鴨川の源流を遡上した際にたどりついたのが貴船の地とされるため、日本神話的には貴船川を鴨川の源流と見なすこともある。
sen.e: Because, in the legend of the Kibune-jinja Shrine, Kibune is considered to be the place where Emperor Jinmu's mother, Tamayori-hime-no-mikoto, reached when going up the sources of the Yodo-gawa and Kamogawa Rivers, some Japanese legends hold that the Kibune-gawa River is the source of the Kamogawa River.

In the legend of the Kibune-jinja Shrine, Kibune is considered to be the place where Emperor Jinmu's mother, Tamayori-hime-no-mikoto, reached when going up the sources of the Yodo-gawa and Kamogawa Rivers, therefore some Japanese legends hold that the Kibune-gawa River is the source of the Kamogawa River.
sen.cmt: Changed sentence to avoid the use of "Because"
sen.e: In the legend of the Kibune-jinja Shrine, Kibune is considered to be the place where Emperor Jinmu's mother, Tamayori-hime-no-mikoto, reached when going up the sources of the Yodo-gawa and Kamogawa Rivers, therefore some Japanese legends hold that the Kibune-gawa River is the source of the Kamogawa River.

sen.j: 鴨川は鞍馬川と合流後、北区上賀茂で京都盆地に出る。
sen.e: Joined by the Kurama-gawa River, the Kamogawa River flows into the Kyoto Basin at Kamigamo, Kita Ward.
Joined by the Kurama-gawa River, the Kamogawa River flows into the Kyoto Basin at Kamigamo, Kita Ward.
Joined by the Kurama-gawa River, the Kamogawa River flows into the Kyoto Basin at Kamigamo, Kita Ward.

sen.j: 上賀茂神社（賀茂別雷神社）、下鴨神社（賀茂御祖神社）脇を南南東に流れ、加茂大橋手前で高野川 (京都市)と合流する。
sen.e: The river further runs south-south-east alongside the Kamigamo-jinja Shrine (Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine) and the Shimogamo Shrine (Kamomioya Shrine), and meets the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) right before the Kamo Ohashi Bridge.

The river further runs south-south-east alongside the Kamigamo-jinja Shrine (Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine) and the Shimogamo Shrine (Kamomioya Shrine), and meets the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) right before the Kamo Ohashi Bridge.

The river further runs south-south-east alongside the Kamigamo-jinja Shrine (Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine) and the Shimogamo-jinja Shrine (Kamomioya Shrine), and meets the Takano-gawa River (Kyoto City) right before the Kamo Ohashi Bridge.

sen.j: そこから京都市内を真南に流れ、四条大橋付近から南西流に転じ、伏見区下鳥羽で桂川 (淀川水系)に注ぐ。
sen.e: Then, the river flows due south through Kyoto City, runs south-west from around the Shijo Ohashi Bridge, and flows into the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) at Shimotoba, Fushimi Ward.
Then, the river flows due south through Kyoto City, runs south-west from around the Shijo Ohashi Bridge, and into the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) at Shimotoba, Fushimi Ward.
Then, the river flows due south through Kyoto City, runs south-west from around the Shijo Ohashi Bridge, and into the Katsura-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River System) at Shimotoba, Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: また、中京区で西に高瀬川 (京都府)を分け、以南で並行する。
sen.e: Additionally, in Nakagyo Ward, the Kamogawa River splits west into the Takase-gawa River and runs southward parallel to it.
Additionally, in Nakagyo Ward, the Kamogawa River splits west into the Takase-gawa River and runs southward parallel to it.
Additionally, in Nakagyo Ward, the Kamogawa River splits west into the Takase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) and runs southward parallel to it.

sen.j: 1964年（昭和39年）公布、翌年施行の河川法により、起点よりすべて鴨川の表記に統一されているが、通例として、高野川 (京都市)との合流点より上流は賀茂川または加茂川と表記される。
sen.e: As a result of the River Act, which was proclaimed in 1964 and implemented in the following year, the name of the 'Kamogawa' (Kamogawa River) from the starting point to the entire downstream is officially written as 鴨川 in kanji; however, the Kamogawa River upstream from the junction with the Takano River (Kyoto City) is conventionally written as 賀茂川 or 加茂川.

As a result of the River Act, which was proclaimed in 1964 and implemented in the following year, the name of the 'Kamogawa' (Kamogawa River) from the starting point to the entire downstream is officially written as 鴨川 in kanji; however, the Kamogawa River upstream from the junction with the Takano River (Kyoto City) is conventionally written as 賀茂川 or 加茂川.

As a result of the River Act, which was proclaimed in 1964 and implemented in the following year, the name of the Kamogawa (Kamogawa River) from the starting point to the entire downstream is officially written as 鴨川 in kanji; however, the Kamogawa River upstream from the junction with the Takano River (Kyoto City) is conventionally written as 賀茂川 or 加茂川.

sen.j: 「日本紀略」では「鴨川」「賀茂川」どちらの表記も混在しているが、平安時代には流域により表記を区別していたわけではない。
sen.e: In the Nihon Kiryaku (historical books written in the Heian period), the Kamogawa River is written as 鴨川 or 賀茂川, but this does not indicate that people at that time distinguished between the two notations according to the part of the river.

In the Nihon Kiryaku (historical books written in the Heian period), the Kamogawa River is written as 鴨川 or 賀茂川, but this does not indicate that people at that time distinguished between the two notations according to the part of the river.

sen.j: 平安京の東部を流れることから、古くは東河とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: The river was also called the Higashi-no-gawa River since it ran in the east (or "higashi" in Japanese) of the Heian-kyo.
The river was also called the Higashi-no-gawa River since it ran in the east (or "higashi" in Japanese) of the Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 鴨川上流の雲ヶ畑には、特別天然記念物のオオサンショウウオが棲む。
sen.e: A special natural treasure, the Japanese giant salamander, lives in Kumogahata in the upper Kamogawa River.

sen.j: 大雨の後などに京都市街まで流されてくることがある。
sen.e: After a heavy rain, some of the salamanders are sometimes swept downstream into the urban area of Kyoto City.

sen.j: ユリカモメ
sen.e: Black-headed gull

sen.j: 10月下旬から5月上旬ごろまで、琵琶湖で越冬しながら毎日鴨川まで通って来る。
sen.e: From the late October to the early May, black-headed gulls fly to the Kamogawa River every day while spending the winter at Lake Biwa.
From the late October to early May, black-headed gulls fly to the Kamogawa River every day while spending the winter at Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 今では冬の風物詩と化しているが、鴨川に姿を見せるようになったのは意外に新しく、1974年のことである。
sen.e: Their presence at the Kamogawa River is presently a typical winter scene, but it was in 1974, relatively recently, that they appeared at the river for the first time.
While their presence at the Kamogawa River is presently a typical winter scene, their presence is relatively recent, and they first appeared in 1974.

sen.j: 伊勢物語では、都鳥（ユリカモメ）のことを「京には見えぬ鳥」と記している。
sen.e: In the Ise Monogatari (Tales of Ise), a bird called "miyako-dori" (black-headed gulls) is described as "a bird unseen in Kyoto."

sen.j: 古代の鴨川上流域は賀茂氏の本拠地であった。
sen.e: The Kamo clan was based around the upper Kamogawa River in ancient times.

sen.j: 上賀茂神社、下鴨神社はその氏神を祀る。
sen.e: The Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and Shimogamo Shrine enshrine the clan's tutelary deity.

sen.j: 下流域には山背国に配置された秦氏が定住していた。
sen.e: The Hata clan, who was assigned the Yamashiro Province, settled in around the lower Kamogawa River.
The Hata clan, who was assigned the Yamashiro Province, settled in around the lower Kamogawa River.

sen.j: 平安京においては、都の東限であった。
sen.e: The Kamogawa River was the eastern limit of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: これは、風水の四神相応の思想を反映したものである。
sen.e: This was influenced by the belief in feng shui "Shijin Soo," an ideal topography for the four Taoist gods, with a river in the east, a broad avenue in the west, a basin in the south, and a hill in the north.

sen.j: 賀茂大橋から四条大橋までの一直線の河道はこの時に固定されたと考えられている。
sen.e: The straight waterway between the Kamo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges was believed to have been secured at this period.
The straight waterway between the Kamo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges was believed to have been secured at this period.
The straight waterway between the Kamo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges was believed to have been secured at this period.

sen.j: 中世には京都市街に隣接する河原が歓楽地となり、多くの芸人が集まるようになった。
sen.e: In the Medieval period, its riverside adjacent to the urban area of Kyoto City prospered as an entertainment spot and attracted many entertainers.
In the Medieval period, its riverside adjacent to the urban area of Kyoto City prospered as an entertainment spot and attracted many entertainers.

sen.j: その中の一人に出雲阿国がいる。
sen.e: Okuni IZUMO is one of them.
One of these was Okuni IZUMO.

sen.e: One of these was Okuni IZUMO.

sen.j: 1614年（慶長19年）には角倉了以・素庵父子によって高瀬川 (京都府)が開鑿され、京都と大阪を結ぶ水路として利用された。
sen.e: In 1614, Ryoi SUMINOKURA and his son, Soan, built a canal, called Takase-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), and the canal was used as a waterway to connect Kyoto and Osaka.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年）には琵琶湖疏水によって琵琶湖とも結ばれた。
sen.e: The canal was connected with Lake Biwa via Lake Biwa Canal in 1890.
The canal was connected with Lake Biwa via Lake Biwa Canal in 1890.

sen.j: しかし20世紀に入ると、鉄道の開通によりこれらの水運は衰退した。
sen.e: In the 20th century, however, water transport via these waterways declined due to the opening of the railroad.
In the 20th century, however, water transport via these waterways declined due to the opening of the railroad.

sen.j: 古来鴨川は氾濫を繰り返す暴れ川として知られていた。
sen.e: The Kamogawa River was known for having been flooded repeatedly from old times.
The Kamogawa River was known for having been flooded repeatedly from old times.
The Kamogawa River was known for having been flooded repeatedly from old times.

sen.j: これは大都市を流れる河川としては勾配が急であることに加え、平安京造営時に北山の木が伐採されたこと、市街地の東への拡大にともない河原が市街地化したことなどが原因である。
sen.e: This problem arises because the Kamogawa River has a steep gradient for a river running through a big city, trees of Mt. Kitayama were logged to build Heian-kyo, and the riverside has become a part of the urban area with the eastward expansion of the area.

sen.j: 824年（天長元年）には治水を担当する防鴨河使（ぼうかし）という官職が設けられたが、洪水はやまなかった。
sen.e: The government post to be in charge of river improvement "Bokashi" was established in 824, which did not prevent floods from occurring, however.
The government post "Bokashi," charged with river improvement was established in 824, but did not prevent floods from occurring.
The government post Bokashi, charged with river improvement was established in 824, but did not prevent floods from occurring.

sen.j: 平安末期に権勢をふるった白河法皇は、自らの意に沿わないもの（天下三大不如意）の筆頭に「賀茂の水」を挙げている。
sen.e: Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa, who held the reins of power in the late Heian period, raised the issue of 'water of the Kamogawa River' first as one of his tenka-sandai-funyoi (three biggest issues on earth that he could not control).

Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa, who held the reins of power in the late Heian period, raised the issue of 'water of the Kamogawa River' first as one of his tenka-sandai-funyoi (three biggest issues on earth that he could not control).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の築いた御土居の東部は鴨川に沿っており、堤防としての役割を兼ねていた。
sen.e: The east side of the odoi (mud wall), which Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built, was placed along the Kamogawa River, and functioned as a levee, as well.
The east side of the odoi (mud wall), built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, was placed along the Kamogawa River, and functioned as a levee, as well.

sen.j: また1670年（寛文10年）には今出川通から五条通までの区間に寛文新堤が設けられ、御土居との間が新たな市街地として開発された。
sen.e: In 1670, the Kanbun-shintei (embankment) was built between the Imadegawa-dori and Gojo-dori Streets, and the area between the mud wall and the embankment was developed as an urban area.
In 1670, the Kanbun-shintei (embankment) was built between the Imadegawa-dori and Gojo-dori Streets, and the area between the mud wall and the embankment was developed as an urban area.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）の水害では死傷者83名のほか、三条大橋や五条大橋の流失など大きな被害を出した。
sen.e: The flood in 1935 caused great damage: 83 people were killed or injured, and in addition, the Sanjo Ohashi Bridge and the Gojo Ohashi Bridge were washed away.
The flood in 1935 caused great damage: 83 people were killed or injured, and in addition, the Sanjo Ohashi Bridge and the Gojo Ohashi Bridge were washed away.

sen.j: これを契機に河川改修事業が行なわれ、戦争による中断や一部計画の変更があったものの、1947年（昭和22年）に完成した。
sen.e: As a result of this incident, the river improvement project began and was completed in 1947 despite the suspension by the war and the slight modifications of the project.

sen.j: これにより河道が掘り下げられた他、落差数十cmの堰を多く持つ現在の姿になった。
sen.e: In the project, the river channel was dug deeper, and many weirs tens of centimeters high were built as they are now.
The river channel was then dug deeper, and many weirs tens of centimeters high were built as they are now.
The river channel was then dug deeper, and many weirs tens of centimeters high were built as they are now.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）に塚本常雄が提唱した学説で、賀茂川の下流部分と高野川との合流地点から白川との合流地点までは人工河川であり、本来賀茂川はまっすぐ南下して堀川に合流、高野川は現在の合流地点から南西方向に流れ頂法寺付近で堀川に合流していたという説である。
sen.e: The theory, proposed by Tsuneo TSUKAMOTO in 1932, holds that: the lower Kamogawa River up to the junction with the Takano River and the waterway between the junction and that of the Kamogawa and Shira-kawa Rivers are artificial waterways; originally, the Kamogawa River ran due south and merged with the Hori-kawa River; the Takano River flowed south-west from the current junction and merged with the Hori-kawa River at around the Choho-ji Temple.

The theory, proposed by Tsuneo TSUKAMOTO in 1932, holds that: the lower Kamogawa River up to the junction with the Takano River and the waterway between the junction and that of the Kamogawa and Shira-kawa Rivers are artificial waterways; originally, the Kamogawa River ran due south and merged with the Hori-kawa River; the Takano River flowed south-west from the current junction and merged with the Hori-kawa River at around the Choho-ji Temple.

The theory, proposed by Tsuneo TSUKAMOTO in 1932, holds that: the lower Kamogawa River up to the junction with the Takano River and the waterway between the junction and that of the Kamogawa and Shira-kawa Rivers are artificial waterways; originally, the Kamogawa River ran due south and merged with the Hori-kawa River; the Takano River flowed south-west from the current junction and merged with the Hori-kawa River at around the Choho-ji Temple.

sen.j: 京都盆地は地形が北東から南西に向かって傾いており、賀茂川がそれに逆行して流れているのは不自然であり、本来は低地である堀川通に流れ込むのが自然であるというのがこの説の根源である。
sen.e: The core of the theory is that because the Kyoto Basin slopes from northeast down to southwest, it is unnatural for the Kamogawa River to flow up the slope; thus, the river would have originally flowed down towards the lower ground of the Horikawa-dori Street.

The core of the theory is that because the Kyoto Basin slopes from northeast down to southwest, it is unnatural for the Kamogawa River to flow up the slope; thus, the river would have originally flowed down towards the lower ground of the Horikawa-dori Street.

The core of the theory is that because the Kyoto Basin slopes from northeast down to southwest, it is unnatural for the Kamogawa River to flow up the slope; thus, the river would have originally flowed down towards the lower ground of the Horikawa-dori Street.

sen.j: この「鴨川つけかえ説」は1980年代までは主流であった。
sen.e: The 'Kamogawa River replacement theory' had remained dominant until the 1980's.
The 'Kamogawa River replacement theory' remained dominant until the 1980's.
The 'Kamogawa River replacement theory' remained dominant until the 1980's.

sen.j: しかし後にこの説は同志社大学教授の横山卓雄の研究により論破されている。
sen.e: Subsequently, however, this theory was refuted by the study Takuo YOKOYAMA, Professor at Doshisha University, had conducted.
Subsequently, however, this theory was refuted by the study conducted by Takuo YOKOYAMA, Professor at Doshisha University.
Subsequently, however, this theory was refuted by the study conducted by Takuo YOKOYAMA, Professor at Doshisha University.

sen.j: 地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の工事のときに烏丸中学校付近を掘削したところ、岩盤が発見されて難工事となったが、この地下の岩盤を物理探査法を用いて調査したところ、地下山脈が南東方向に存在することが判明。
sen.e: When the area around Karasuma Junior High School was excavated during the construction work of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto City Subway, bedrock was found, making the construction more difficult; when the underground bedrock was studied through geophysical prospection, it turned out, however, that an underground mountain slopes down southeastward.

When the area around Karasuma Junior High School was excavated during the construction work of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto City Subway, bedrock was found, making the construction more difficult; when the underground bedrock was studied through geophysical prospection, it turned out, however, that an underground mountain slopes down southeastward.

When the area around Karasuma Junior High School was excavated during the construction work of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto City Subway, bedrock was found, making the construction more difficult; when the underground bedrock was studied through geophysical prospection, it turned out, however, that an underground mountain slopes down southeastward.

sen.j: 塚本説で唱えられた川の流れをほぼ直角に横切っているため矛盾点が生じ、現在の賀茂川の流れはその地下山脈の影響を受けた自然な流れだということが判明した。
sen.e: The underground mountain runs at a right angle from the original waterway proposed by Tsukamoto, thereby causing a contradiction; influenced by the underground mountain, in fact, the current waterway of the Kamogawa River proves to be natural.

The underground mountain runs at a right angle from the original waterway proposed by Tsukamoto, thereby causing a contradiction; in fact, the current waterway of the Kamogawa River proves to be natural and is influenced by the underground mountain.

The underground mountain runs at a right angle from the original waterway proposed by Tsukamoto, thereby causing a contradiction; in fact, the current waterway of the Kamogawa River proves to be natural and is influenced by the underground mountain.

sen.j: 納涼床
sen.e: Noryo Yuka
Noryo Yuka
Noryo Yuka

sen.j: 二条大橋から五条大橋にかけての鴨川西岸の料理店では、5月から9月にかけて河原に張り出した木組みの床が設けられる。
sen.e: Restaurants on the west bank of the Kamogawa River build wooden terraces above the riverside between the Nijo Ohashi and Gojo Ohashi Bridges form May to September.
Restaurants on the west bank of the Kamogawa River build wooden terraces above the riverside between the Nijo Ohashi and Gojo Ohashi Bridges form May to September.
Restaurants on the west bank of the Kamogawa River build wooden terraces above the riverside between the Nijo Ohashi and Gojo Ohashi Bridges form May to September.

sen.j: 京友禅
sen.e: Kyo-Yuzen (dyeing technique)
Kyo-Yuzen (dyeing technique)
Kyo-Yuzen (dyeing technique)

sen.j: かつては京友禅を鴨川の流れにさらす「友禅流し」が行なわれていたが、水質悪化などが問題となり1970年代に中止された。
sen.e: Kyo-Yuzen fabrics used to be rinsed in the Kamogawa River (called 'Yuzen Nagashi'), but, due to water pollution, the method was discontinued in the 1970's.
Kyo-Yuzen fabrics used to be rinsed in the Kamogawa River (called 'Yuzen Nagashi'), but, due to water pollution, the method was discontinued in the 1970's.
Kyo-Yuzen fabrics used to be rinsed in the Kamogawa River (called 'Yuzen Nagashi'), but, due to water pollution, the method was discontinued in the 1970's.

sen.j: 鴨川等間隔の法則
sen.e: Principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River
Principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River
Principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River

sen.j: 三条大橋と四条大橋の間の川岸は繁華街から近いこともあり、週末の昼下がりから夜にかけては多くの人がたたずむ。
sen.e: Because the riverside between the Sanjo Ohashi and Gojo Ohashi Bridges is close to the downtown area, many people spend time there from the early afternoon through the night on weekends.
Since the riverside between the Sanjo Ohashi and Gojo Ohashi Bridges is close to the downtown area, many people spend time there from the early afternoon through the night on weekends.
Since the riverside between the Sanjo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges is close to the downtown area, many people spend time there from the early afternoon through the night on weekends.

sen.j: しかしどれだけ人が増えてもカップルやグループの間隔が等間隔であるといわれる事から、この現象は「鴨川等間隔の法則」と呼ばれる事がある。
sen.e: Couples and groups of people are said to keep equal distance to one another no matter how the number of them is increased; therefore, this phenomenon is sometimes called 'principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River.'

Couples and groups of people are said to keep equal distance to one another irregardless of the number of people; therefore, this phenomenon is sometimes called 'principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River.'

Couples and groups of people are said to keep equal distance to one another irregardless of the number of people; therefore, this phenomenon is sometimes called 'principle of equal distance at the Kamogawa River.'

sen.j: また、この区間で男女カップルが接吻をすること「鴨チュー」（かもちゅー＝鴨川でチュー、の意）と呼ばれる事がある（両方とも若者が好んで使う言葉とも言われ、年配者などには通じないとも言われる）。
sen.e: Additionally, couples' kissing on this riverside is sometimes called 'kamo chu,' an abbreviation of 'kissing (chu) at the Kamogawa River (kamo);' yet, these two words are said to be those that young people like to use but older people do not understand.

Additionally, couples' kissing on this riverside is sometimes called 'kamo chu,' an abbreviation of 'kissing (chu) at the Kamogawa River (kamo);' yet, these two words are said to be those that young people like to use but older people do not understand.

Additionally, couples' kissing on this riverside is sometimes called 'kamo chu,' an abbreviation of 'kissing (chu) at the Kamogawa River (kamo)'; yet, these two words are said to be those that young people like to use but older people do not understand.

sen.j: 京都府鴨川条例が、2008年4月1日から施行されている。
sen.e: The Kamogawa River Ordinance of Kyoto Prefecture was enforced on April 1, 2008.
The Kamogawa River Ordinance of Kyoto Prefecture was enforced on April 1, 2008.
The Kamogawa River Ordinance of Kyoto Prefecture was enforced on April 1, 2008.

sen.j: これにより、場所によって自転車の放置、打ち上げ花火・爆竹、バーベキューなどが禁止される。
sen.e: As a result, illegally-parked bicycles, skyrockets, firecrackers, and barbecuing are prohibited in some areas.
As a result, illegally-parked bicycles, skyrockets, firecrackers, and barbecuing are prohibited in some areas.
As a result, illegally-parked bicycles, skyrockets, firecrackers, and barbecuing are prohibited in some areas.

sen.j: 京都市は1980年代以降、三条大橋と四条大橋の中間に歩行者専用の新たな橋を架けることを計画している。
sen.e: Kyoto City has planned to build a new footbridge over the Kamogawa River in the middle between the Sanjo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges.
Kyoto City has planned to build a new footbridge over the Kamogawa River in the middle between the Sanjo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges.
Since the 1980's Kyoto City has planned to build a new footbridge over the Kamogawa River in the middle between the Sanjo Ohashi and Shijo Ohashi Bridges.

sen.j: この計画に対しては、予定地の東側では橋ができると街の活性化につながると賛成する意見がある一方で、西側の先斗町では橋ができて通り道になると街の風情が損なわれると反対する意見が多数を占めていた。
sen.e: People on the east side of the planned footbridge are in favor of the plan since the bridge may well energize the area; on the other hand, those in Ponto-cho on the west side are mostly opposed to it, thinking the planned footbridge would crowd the street and destroy the landscape of the town.

People on the east side of the planned footbridge are in favor of the plan since the bridge may well energize the area; on the other hand, those in Ponto-cho on the west side are mostly opposed to it, thinking the planned footbridge would crowd the street and destroy the landscape of the town.

People on the east side of the planned footbridge are in favor of the plan since the bridge may well energize the area; on the other hand, those in Ponto-cho on the west side are mostly opposed to it, thinking the planned footbridge would crowd the street and destroy the landscape of the town.

sen.j: 1996年、京都を訪問したフランスのジャック・シラク大統領（元パリ市長）は、枡本頼兼市長との会談でセーヌ川のポンデザール (パリ)（芸術橋）を模した橋を鴨川に架けることを提案した。
sen.e: French President Jacques Chirac (former Mayor of Paris) proposed a plan to build a footbridge modeling the Pont des Arts (Arts Bridge) over the Seine River in Paris when he visited Kyoto and met with Mayor Yorikane MASUMOTO in 1996.

French President Jacques Chirac (former Mayor of Paris) proposed a plan to build a footbridge modeling the Pont des Arts (Arts Bridge) over the Seine River in Paris when he visited Kyoto and met with Mayor Yorikane MASUMOTO in 1996.

French President Jacques Chirac (former Mayor of Paris) proposed a plan to build a footbridge modeling the Pont des Arts (Arts Bridge) over the Seine River in Paris when he visited Kyoto and met with Mayor Yorikane MASUMOTO in 1996.

sen.j: 1998年が「日本におけるフランス年」にあたり、また京都市とパリ市の友情盟約締結40周年にあたることから、その記念事業としての構想であったが、この計画が公表されると「新たな名所になる」と歓迎する意見がある一方で、「フランス風のデザイン」が景観を損ねるとの批判も起こり、世論は二分された。
sen.e: As the year 1998 marked 'The Year of France in Japan' and the 40th anniversary of Kyoto-Paris Friendship Pledge, the president's proposal was intended as part of the anniversary celebrations; once the plan was made public, however, public opinion was divided into two opposing groups: some welcomed the plan because the planned footbridge would attract more visitors while others criticized the French-style architecture, for it would ruin the landscape.

As the year 1998 marked 'The Year of France in Japan' and the 40th anniversary of Kyoto-Paris Friendship Pledge, the president's proposal was intended as part of the anniversary celebrations; once the plan was made public, however, public opinion was divided into two opposing groups: some welcomed the plan because the planned footbridge would attract more visitors while others criticized the French-style architecture, for it would ruin the landscape.

As the year 1998 marked 'The Year of France in Japan' and the 40th anniversary of Kyoto-Paris Friendship Pledge, the president's proposal was intended as part of the anniversary celebrations; once the plan was made public, however, public opinion was divided into two opposing groups: some welcomed the plan because the planned footbridge would attract more visitors while others criticized the French-style architecture, for it would ruin the landscape.

sen.j: 1997年に行なわれた都市計画案の公告・縦覧では計画に賛成する意見書が反対を上回ったものの、これに対しても計画に反対する市民団体から「意見書の内容を充分に検討することなく数のみを比較している」と、計画決定の拙速さが批判の対象となった。
sen.e: From public notice and access to the city planning of 1997, it turned out that the number of public comments for the footbridge plan surpassed that of public comments against it; nonetheless, citizen groups opposing the plan criticized the decision as hasty, saying that the city had compared only the numbers of the comments without thoroughly examining the contents of them.

From public notice and access to the city planning of 1997, it turned out that the number of public comments for the footbridge plan surpassed that of public comments against it; nonetheless, citizen groups opposing the plan criticized the decision as hasty, saying that the city had compared only the numbers of the comments without thoroughly examining the contents of them.

From public notice and access to the city planning of 1997, it turned out that the number of public comments for the footbridge plan surpassed that of public comments against it; nonetheless, citizen groups opposing the plan criticized the decision as hasty, saying that the city had compared only the numbers of the comments without thoroughly examining the contents of them.

sen.j: またフランスのルモンド紙が計画を批判する記事を掲載するなど、京都市外をも巻き込んだ論争となった。
sen.e: As the French newspaper Le Monde also published an article criticizing the plan, the dispute involved an entity outside the city.
As the French newspaper Le Monde also published an article criticizing the plan, the dispute involved an entity outside the city.
As the French newspaper Le Monde also published an article criticizing the plan, the dispute involved an entity outside the city.

sen.j: 結局1998年に市は芸術橋計画を白紙撤回したが、歩道橋計画そのものについてはなお意欲的である。
sen.e: In 1998, Kyoto City finally withdrew the plan to build the Arts Bridge, but is still eager to forward the plan to build a footbridge.
In 1998, Kyoto City finally withdrew the plan to build the Arts Bridge, but is still eager to forward the plan to build a footbridge.
In 1998, Kyoto City finally withdrew the plan to build the Arts Bridge, but is still eager to forward the plan to build a footbridge.

sen.j: 岩屋橋 - 出合橋 - 山幸橋 - 高橋 - 庄田橋 - 志久呂橋 - 西賀茂橋 - 御薗橋 - 上賀茂橋 - 北山大橋（北山通） - 北大路橋（北大路通） - 出雲路橋 - 葵橋（下鴨本通） - 賀茂大橋（今出川通） - 荒神橋 - 丸太町橋（丸太町通） - 二条大橋（二条通） - 御池大橋（御池通） - 三条大橋（三条通） - 四条大橋（四条通） - 団栗橋 - 松原橋（松原通） - 五条大橋 - 正面橋 - 七条大橋（七条通） - 塩小路橋（塩小路通） - （西日本旅客鉄道東海道本線鉄橋） - （東海旅客鉄道東海道新幹線鉄橋） - （JR奈良線鉄橋） - 東山橋（九条通） - 陶化橋（十条通） - 勧進橋（竹田街道） - 水鶏橋 - （近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線鉄橋） - 竹田橋 - 京都南大橋（油小路通） - 大宮大橋（大宮通） - 鳥羽大橋（国道1号） - 鴨川橋（名神高速道路） - 小枝橋 - 京川橋
sen.e: Iwaya-bashi Bridge, Deai-bashi Bridge, Sanko-bashi Bridge, Taka-bashi Bridge, Shoda-bashi Bridge, Shikuro-bashi Bridge, Nishikamo-bashi Bridge, Misono-bashi Bridge, Kamigamo-bashi Bridge, Kitayama Ohashi Bridge (Kitayama-dori Street), Kitaoji-bashi Bridge (Kitaoji-dori Street), Izumoji-bashi Bridge, Aoi-bashi Bridge (Shimogamo-Hondori Street), Kamo Ohashi Bridge (Imadegawa-dori Street), Kojin-bashi Bridge, Marutamachi-bashi Bridge (Marutamachi-dori Street), Nijo Ohashi Bridge (Nijo-dori Street), Oike Ohashi Bridge (Oike-dori Street), Sanjo Ohashi Bridge (Sanjo-dori Street), Shijo Ohashi Bridge (Shijo-dori Street), Donguri-bashi Bridge, Matsubara-bashi Bridge (Matsubara-dori Street), Gojo Ohashi Bridge, Shomen-bashi Bridge, Shichijo Ohashi Bridge (Shichijo-dori Street), Shiokoji-bashi Bridge (Shiokoji-dori Street), Rail bridge on the Tokaido Main Line of West Japan Railway, Rail bridge on the Tokaido Shinkansen of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), Rail bridge on the JR Nara Line, Higashiyama-bashi Bridge (Kujo-dori Street), Toka-bashi Bridge (Jujo-dori Street), Kanjin-bashi Bridge (Takeda-kaido Road, or 竹田街道), Kuina-bashi Bridge, Rail bridge on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Railways, Takeda-bashi Bridge, Kyoto Minami Ohashi Bridge (Abura-koji-dori Street), Omiya Ohashi Bridge (Omiya-dori Street), Toba Ohashi Bridge (National Highway 1), Kamogawa-bashi Bridge (Meishin Expressway), Koeda-bashi Bridge, and Kyokawa-bashi Bridge
